−
'''Ethics''' (from the [[Ancient Greek]] "''ethikos''", meaning "arising from habit"; also '''Morality'''), a major branch of [[philosophy]], is the study of [[Value theory|value]], or [[morals]] and [[morality]]. It covers the [[Philosophical analysis|analysis]] and employment of [[concept]]s such as [[right]], [[wrong]], [[good]], [[evil]], and [[moral responsibility|responsibility]]. It is divided into three primary areas: ''meta-ethics'' (the study of the concept of ethics), ''normative ethics'' (the study of how to determine ethical values), and ''applied ethics'' (the study of the use of ethical values).
+
'''Ethics''' (from the [[Ancient Greek]] "''εθικος''" ("''ethikos''"), meaning "arising from habit"; also '''Morality'''), a major branch of [[philosophy]], is the study of [[Value theory|value]], or [[morals]] and [[morality]]. It covers the [[Philosophical analysis|analysis]] and employment of [[concept]]s such as [[right]], [[wrong]], [[good]], [[evil]], and [[moral responsibility|responsibility]]. It is divided into three primary areas: ''meta-ethics'' (the study of the concept of ethics), ''normative ethics'' (the study of how to determine ethical values), and ''applied ethics'' (the study of the use of ethical values).
